Package info.dnsdb.client

Class Query

java.lang.Object
info.dnsdb.client.Query
public class Query extends Object
An object used for setting parameters and executing DNSDB Queries. This is written so that developers can use the fluent API pattern, eg. query.rrtype("A").limit(5).stream()
Author:
Farsight Security, Inc. <support@farsightsecurity.com>
See Also:
Farsight DNSDB API Documentation.

  • Method Details

    • disableLimitedException

      public Query disableLimitedException​(boolean ok)
      Disable throwing of QueryLimitedException.
      Parameters:
      ok - True to disable throwing QueryLimitedException, false to enable.
      Returns:
      The Query object for further use in the fluent API pattern.

    • rrtype

      public Query rrtype​(String rrtype)
      Set the rrtype parameter of the query. This limits results to only that rrtype, or all rrtypes in the case of RRTYPE_ANY.
      Parameters:
      rrtype - The rrtype to limit results to.
      Returns:
      The Query object for further use in the fluent API pattern.

    • bailiwick

      public Query bailiwick​(String bailiwick)
      Set the bailiwick parameter of the query. This limits results to those returned by nameservers that are authoritative to the specified bailiwick. For example: a bailiwick of com would only include results from the GTLD servers.
      Parameters:
      bailiwick - The bailiwick to limit results to.
      Returns:
      The Query object for further use in the fluent API pattern.
      See Also:
      rrset lookups.

    • timeFirstBefore

      public Query timeFirstBefore​(int time)
      Provide results before the defined timestamp for when the DNS record was first observed.
      Parameters:
      time - Seconds since the epoch for an absolute timestamp, negative number for a relative timestamp.
      Returns:
      The Query object for further use in the fluent API pattern.
      See Also:
      Time-fencing query parameters.

    • limit

      public Query limit​(int limit)
      Limit for the number of results returned via these lookup methods. There is a built-in limit to the number of results that are returned via these lookup methods. The default limit is set at 10,000. This limit can be raised or lowered by setting the “limit” query parameter. There is also a maximum number of results allowed; requesting a limit greater than the maximum will only return the maximum. See results_max below for information on that maximum. If “?limit=0” is used then DNSDB will return the maximum number of results allowed. Obviously, if there are less results for the query than the requested limit, only the actual amount can be returned.
      Parameters:
      limit - Number of rows.
      Returns:
      The Query object for further use in the fluent API pattern.
      See Also:
      Other query parameters.

    • swClient

      public Query swClient​(String swclient)
      Name of the API client software generating the DNSDB query. Limited to twenty alphanumeric characters. This may be logged by the DNSDB API server. Farsight support can help you debug a new API client using this and the following parameter. The default is "java".
      Parameters:
      swclient - Alphanumeric string to submit for swclient.
      Returns:
      The Query object for further use in the fluent API pattern.
      See Also:
      Other query parameters.

    • version

      public Query version​(String version)
      Version number of the API client software generating the DNSDB query. Limited to twenty alphanumeric characters plus dash, underscore, and period. This may be logged by the DNSDB API server. There is no default.
      Parameters:
      version - Alphanumeric version string to submit for version.
      Returns:
      The Query object for further use in the fluent API pattern.
      See Also:
      Other query parameters.

    • id

      public Query id​(String id)
      Client software specific identity of the user of the API client. Comprised of an alphanumeric string, a colon, and an alphanumeric string, limited to thirty characters. This may be logged by the DNSDB API server. There is no default.
      Parameters:
      id - Alphanumeric string with a colon to submit for id.
      Returns:
      The Query object for further use in the fluent API pattern.
      See Also:
      Other query parameters.

    • aggr

      public Query aggr​(boolean on)
      Aggregated results group identical rrsets across all time periods and is the classic behavior from querying the DNSDB. This means you could get the total number of times an rrset has been observed, but not when it was observed. Unaggregated results ungroup identical rrsets, allowing you to see how the domain name was resolved in the DNS across the full-time range covered in DNSDB (subject to time fencing). This can give a more accurate impression of record request volume across time because it will reveal the distinct timestamps of records whose values are repeated. You can answer questions like, “Was a domain parked for a long time, mostly unused, until it was repurposed for serving malware or relaying spam, but then was abandoned again?” It allows you to see if a record was observed heavily in the last week vs. having been observed constantly for years.
      Parameters:
      on - True to enable, false to disable.
      Returns:
      The Query object for further use in the fluent API pattern.
      See Also:
      Other query parameters.

    • humanTime

      public Query humanTime​(boolean on)
      A boolean value that is True if time values (in time_first, time_last, zone_time_first, zone_time_last) should be returned in human readable (RFC3339 compliant) format or False if Unix-style time values in seconds since the epoch should be returned. False is the classic behavior from querying the DNSDB and is the default value for this option.
      Parameters:
      on - True to enable, false to disable.
      Returns:
      The Query object for further use in the fluent API pattern.
      See Also:
      Other query parameters.

    • offset

      public Query offset​(int offset)
      How many rows to offset (e.g. skip) in the results. This implements an incremental result transfer feature, allowing you to view more of the available results for a single query. The rows are offset prior to the limit parameter being applied, therefore offset allows seeing additional results past a limit that matches the maximum number of results. Note that DNSDB recalculates the results for each query and the order of results might not be preserved. Therefore, this capability is not a valid way to walk all results over multiple queries – some results might be missing and some might be duplicated. The actual offset that can be used is limited or for certain API keys, offset is not allowed – see the offset_max rate_limit key below. The offset value must be a positive integer. The default is 0, which means do not offset the rows.
      Parameters:
      offset - How many rows to offset (e.g. skip) in the results.
      Returns:
      The Query object for further use in the fluent API pattern.
      See Also:
      Additional query parameter for lookup.

    • maxCount

      public Query maxCount​(int maxCount)
      max_count controls stopping when we reach that summary count. The resulting total count can exceed max_count as it will include the entire count from the last rrset examined. The default is to not constrain the count.
      Parameters:
      maxCount - Count at which to stop summarizing.
      Returns:
      The Query object for further use in the fluent API pattern.
      See Also:
      Additional query parameter for summarize.

    • exclude

      public Query exclude​(String exclude)
      The "exclude" parameter is used to exclude (i.e. filter-out) results that match. Conceptually, this is like the shell pipeline: egrep $VALUE <DNSDB | egrep -v $exclude. Its value is a regular expression or glob, depending upon the search_method.
      Parameters:
      exclude - A glob or regular expression.
      Returns:
      The Query object for further use in the fluent API pattern.
      See Also:
      Optional query parameters for Flexible Search., The exclude parameter.

    • stream

      public Iterator<org.json.JSONObject> stream()
      Execute the query, returning an Iterator of results. The Iterator will throw the same exceptions listed below on calls to next() and hasNext().
      Returns:
      An Iterator of JSON objects formatted per the query endpoint used.
      Throws:
      DNSDBException - If the server returns an invalid status code.
      DNSDBException - If the connection was unsuccessful.
      InvalidJSONException - If invalid JSON data is returned by the server.
      TruncatedResponseException - If the response does not include a trailer or is otherwise truncated.
      UnexpectedCondException - If the server sends an unknown condition or a condition at the wrong state.
      QueryLimitedException - If the server reports that the result set was incomplete.
      QueryFailedException - If the server reports that the query has failed.
      See Also:
      rrset results for lookup., rdata results for lookup., rrnames results for flex., rdata results for flex.
